0.title: Tesla stock rises despite sales miss, Microsoft to cut 9K jobs
0.summary: tesla stock rises despite sales miss, microsoft to cut 9k jobs yahoo finance's john hyland takes a closer look at some of the top stories on wall street as part of today's market minute. investors are shrugging off the latest adp report showing an unexpected decline in job growth for june. tesla (tsla) stock is climbing despite the company reporting a 13% drop in vehicle deliveries in its second quarter. microsoft (msft) plans to cut 9,000 jobs in its second major workforce reduction this year. stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with yahoo finance's market minute.

1.title: Microsoft to cut workforce by up to 4% in latest round of layoffs
1.summary: microsoft to cut workforce by up to 4% in latest round of layoffs microsoft said it will cut less than 4% of its workforce, or roughly 9,000 jobs, as it aims to get rid of layers of management and utilize new technologies. the news comes as the company invests billions in its ai efforts.

5.title: Nvidia briefly on track to become world's most valuable company ever
5.summary: nvidia briefly on track to become world's most valuable company ever (reuters) -nvidia hit a market value of $3.92 trillion on thursday, briefly putting it on track to become the most valuable company in history, as wall street doubled down on optimism about ai.  shares of the leading designer of high-end ai chips rose as much as 2.4% to $160.98 in morning trading, giving the company a higher market capitalization than apple's record closing value of $3.915 trillion on december 26, 2024.  the shares were last up 1.5% at $159.60, leaving nvidia's stock market value at $3.89 trillion, just short of apple's record.

6.title: Super Micro Stock Has Rebounded Since Tariffs Scare. Why It Can Surge Higher.
6.summary: super micro stock has rebounded since tariffs scare. why it can surge higher. super micro computer  stock has rebounded since selling off sharply in the wake of president donald trump’s “liberation day” tariffs announcement—and it could surge higher, according to one analyst who says there’s still time to buy in.  mizuho  analyst vijay rakesh raised his price target on shares of the server maker to $47 from $40 in a note thursday and maintained a neutral rating.

9.title: Microsoft commences ‘deep’ cuts across Xbox unit, Bloomberg reports

1.title: This portfolio manager’s secret for finding the next Nvidia
1.summary: this portfolio manager’s secret for finding the next nvidia listen and subscribe to stocks in translation on apple podcasts, spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.with ai powering a resilient bull market, savvy investors can still spot breakout opportunities hiding in plain sight.in this episode of stocks in translation, zor capital portfolio manager joe fahmy joins yahoo finance senior reporter allie canal and producer sydnee fried to discuss the current market and what to watch for in the tech sector. fahmy also provides insight on the signals he uses to find stocks - like nvidia (nvda) - that could be the next breakout star. twice a week, stocks in translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. you can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. this post was written by lauren pokedoff

9.title: Why Is Alphabet Stock Worth Less Than Nvidia, Microsoft, Apple, and Amazon Even Though It Is the Most Profitable S&P 500 Company?
9.summary: why is alphabet stock worth less than nvidia, microsoft, apple, and amazon even though it is the most profitable s&p 500 company? alphabet would be the most valuable company in the world if it were valued similarly to its peers.  it seems that earnings don't directly translate into higher share prices over the short term.  the stock market cares more about future earnings potential than the past -- and that may be why nvidia, microsoft, apple (nasdaq: aapl), and amazon (nasdaq: amzn) are all worth more than alphabet (nasdaq: goog) (nasdaq: googl) today even though alphabet is the only s&p 500 stock with over $100 billion in trailing-12-month net income.
